alert.note: Alert for Central and Eastern Montgomery County; Clark; Garland; Hot Spring; Northern Montgomery County Higher Elevations; Northern Polk County Higher Elevations; Pike; Polk County Lower Elevations; Southeast Polk County Higher Elevations; Southwest Montgomery County Higher Elevations (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 7:41PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Clark, northern Pike, southwestern Garland, northeastern Polk, Montgomery and west central Hot Spring Counties through 815 PM CDT... At 741 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Opal, or 15 miles north of Umpire, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hot Springs... Mount Ida... Glenwood... Mountain Pine... Amity... Norman... Little Missouri Falls Recreatio... Meyers... Lofton... Rockwell... DeGray Lake State Park... Bard Springs Recreation Area... Mauldin... Albert Pike Recreation Area... Hot Springs Memorial Field... Opal... Mimosa... Shady... Hartley... Caney Creek Wilderness... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for central, western and southwestern Arkansas.
